flawed_nl_solution:
Marta had 1000 kg of tomatoes on Friday and sold 300 kg on Saturday, so she has 1000 - 300 = <<1000-300=720>>720 kg of tomatoes left.
On Sunday 200 kg of tomatoes had to be thrown away, so 720 - 200 = <<720-200=520>>520 kg of tomatoes were left.
The shipment on Monday was twice the size of the first one, so it was 2 * 1000 = <<2*1000=2000>>2000 kg of tomatoes.
The total amount of tomatoes ready for sale on Tuesday was 520 + 2000 = <<520+2000=2520>>2520 kg.
#### 2520

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 700, not 720. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
